result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Russell Davis Ferrie was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Russell Davis Ferrie was found guilty of Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $900 fine plus costs. Cash bond applied. 60 days to pay fine/costs owing or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office.
10 days STAYED upon attendance at VIP. Huber release and good time granted. Credit for time served. To commence forthwith.
Any vehicle driven by or registered to Defendant during period of IID restriction must be equipped with Ignition Interlock Device unless otherwise ordered by the Court.

Obtain alcohol assessment through Door County Human Services and comply with treatment recommendations. Must attend the Door/Kewaunee Victim Impact Panel session scheduled for 2/09/17 at the Justice Center.

chargeModifiers.descr: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment as directed by DOC.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to Ct. 1 - STAYED.  To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from defendant requesting credit for time served. Court responds - in 16-CM-110, defendant bonded out after 1 day. Apparently is getting credit for that. In 16-CM-121, defendant sat on cash bond for 8/22/16 to 9/07/16. Must be 14 days defendant is referring to in letter. He was placed on probation in that file. Will only get credit for days sat if he's revoked. DTE
Inmate request form - defendant requests breakdown of fines/costs and how cash bonds were applied. Clerk sent copy of assessment report to defendant in the jail.
for DNA Sample

Defendant Russell Davis Ferrie in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Cts. 1 & 2. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. Court dismisses Cts. 3 & 4 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Russell Davis Ferrie in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Defendant Russell Davis Ferrie in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Amended Complaint given to Defense in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties. Defense enters not guilty plea to Count 4. Defense advises that parties are close to agreement, advises that Defendant has things to get into place for Huber, questions whether bond in 16CM121 could be amended for 5-7 days to allow that to happen before entering plea. State presents argument against amendment of bond. Court will not amend bond.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 10:30 am.
